properties.name: Glyne Gap Field
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. 2 injured in Kent Close.

properties.name: Cooden Beach
properties.description: Four bombs dropped on foreshore.

properties.name: Cooden Beach
properties.description: Four bombs dropped on foreshore.

properties.name: Cooden Beach
properties.description: Four bombs dropped on foreshore.

properties.name: Cooden Beach
properties.description: Four bombs dropped on foreshore.

properties.name: 10 Woodsgate Avenue
properties.description: Margaret Lawrence (25), Margaret I. Lawrence (55) and Caroline Massey (68) killed.

properties.name: 13-17 Jameson Road
properties.description: Three houses destroyed.

properties.name: 144 De La Warr Road
properties.description: A bomb struck a house chimney on the opposite side of De La Warr Road, flew across the road to number 144. It entered the bedroom window, crossed the landing and exited the house at the rear before exploding on the open ground. The damage rendered the house uninhabitable and adjacent houses had their windows blown in.

properties.name: 19 Dalehurst Road
properties.description: Harriet R. Tidd (23) of number 30 Dalehurst Road killed.

properties.name: 27-31 Devonshire Road
properties.description: Mid day raid. 6 bombs. Three buildings destroyed. 3 Killed, 22 injured. Shops destroyed: Perrett & Co chemist, Hilton & Sons boot makers, Flinn & Sons dyers and cleaners and H. Carter butcher. Alfred V. Barker (19) delivery boy, Violet B. Rose (27) shop assistant at Flinn's and Frederick G. Kerley (70), a passer-by, were killed.

properties.name: 30 Cantelupe Road
properties.description: Landed in garden but did not explode until five hours later. Caused upheaval of the road and displacement of roof tiles on surrounding houses. No casualties.

properties.name: L.J. Collis & Co Chemist, 34 St Leonards Road
properties.description: Shop destroyed and proprietor Leslie J. Collis (44) killed.

properties.name: 35 Station Road
properties.description: William G. Reeves (53) killed at his newsagent shop.

properties.name: 4 Millfield Rise
properties.description: Unexploded bomb discovered, possibly dropped 08 October.

properties.name: 4 Wilton Road
properties.description: Gas main fracture.

properties.name: 42 Bancroft Road
properties.description: Sisters Annie L. Coverdale (75) and Evelyn Coverdale (62) occupants of No 42 taken to Bexhill Hospital where they died. 2 others injured. No 40 also destroyed and 44 and 46 damaged.

properties.name: 5 Gloucester Avenue
properties.description: Considerable blast damage done. The homes of Henrietta Watson and next door, daughter in law Iris Watson and her daughter Muriel A. Watson (4) were destroyed. All three taken to hospital by ambulance, Muriel died, another eight people injured. Residents of Gloucester Avenue evacuated.

properties.name: 57 Amherst Road
properties.description: Heavy raid injuring five people. Thomas Mepham (69) and his brother in law William Turner (62) taken to hospital at Epsom where they both subsequently died.

properties.name: 57 Devonshire Road
properties.description: Longley Brothers shop and the Bexhill Observer office were destroyed. Today you can see these buildings were never rebuilt to their full height.

properties.name: 7 Westville Road
properties.description: Edith E. Few (65) and Lily A. Smith (54) killed by a low level bomb that had sliced through numbers 9 and 11. 5 injured.

properties.name: Adams Farm, Sandrock Hill
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Ancaster House, Penland Road
properties.description: Tennis courts opposite to school.

properties.name: Barnhorn Road
properties.description: Three bombs dropped north of The Broadwalk in open country. The first bombs dropped on Bexhill.

properties.name: Barrack Road
properties.description: Direct hit on Barrack Road air raid shelter. No casualties.

properties.name: Barrack Road Cemetery
properties.description: Bomb landed amongst the graves, elm trees were uprooted and a piece of tombstone was hurled at a motor vehicle.

properties.name: Beach between Brockley Road and Richmond Road
Beach between Brockley Road and Richmond Road
Bexhill Golf Course
properties.description: Land mine.

properties.name: Bexhill Golf Course
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. 7 injured.

properties.name: Bexhill Hospital, Holliers Hill
properties.description: 9 bombs dropped. All doors and windows were blown in and roof was damaged. 1 injury to a patient by flying glass.

properties.name: St Barnabas Vicarage, Brassey Road
properties.description: Unoccupied vicarage destroyed. Lodge (37 Sea Rd) severely damaged. St. Barnabas Church south windows destroyed including an original depicting St. Luke called 'Good Physician'.

imgattrib.0: St Barnabas' Bexhill 1891-1951, Gowing King Bros & Potts Ltd | © C. Hollyfield

properties.name: Suffolk House, Brassey Road
properties.description: Bexhill's greatest loss of life in one incident. Ada M. Adamson (75), Jane C. Cana (84), Edith L. Corke (39) and Eleanor M. Coventry (65) killed. 2 other occupants seriously injured.

properties.name: Buckhurst Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb. Exploded 22 May 2009 during building work.

properties.name: Twinehams, Buckhurst Road
properties.description: John Croft (41) killed. Bexhill's first fatality. Two other workmen at premises injured.

properties.name: Caffyn's Garage, Station Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Cantelupe Road
properties.description: Landed on pavement but did not explode until five hours later. Caused upheaval of the road and displacement of roof tiles on surrounding houses. No casualties.

properties.name: Collington Mansions, Collington Avenue
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Collington Wood
properties.description: Unexploded bomb, controlled explosion 05 December 1940.

properties.name: Collington Wood
properties.description: Unexploded bomb, removed June 1946.

properties.name: Coniston, 7 Hartfield Road
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. Gunner William Lines 1085602 of the 150/71 Field Regiment Royal artillery killed in an adjoining property.

properties.name: Cooden Golf Links
properties.description: Land mine.

properties.name: De La Warr Pavilion, Marina
properties.description: Destroyed dressing rooms and some of the backstage area. The buildings foundations also suffered minor damage.

properties.name: Fishers Yard, Egerton Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb which exploded 1st October at 01:15 hours.

properties.name: Field north of Pebsham Lane
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Glenleigh Park Road junction of Kingswood Avenue
Glovers Farm, Glovers Lane
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. 8 injured, including 1 hospitalised, 5 cattle killed.

properties.name: Hastings Gas Works
properties.description: Low level attack, three bombs. 15 injured, of which Bertram G. Niner (39) of Bulverhythe died 3 days later and William M. Day (59), also of Bulverhythe, died a fortnight later.

properties.name: Hastings Gas works
properties.description: Low level attack, three bombs. 15 injured, of which Bertram G. Niner (39) of Bulverhythe died 3 days later and William M. Day (59), also of Bulverhythe, died a fortnight later.

properties.name: Hastings Gas Works
properties.description: Low level attack, three bombs. 15 injured, of which Bertram G. Niner (39) of Bulverhythe died 3 days later and William M. Day (59), also of Bulverhythe, died a fortnight later.

properties.name: Highwoods Golf Course
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb.

properties.name: Knole Court, Knole Road
properties.description: A bomb removed one of the gables and the two entrances. The gable wasn't restored until the late 1950s - early 1960s with the two entrances replaced in a 1950s style that broke the symmetry of the northern elevation. These were restored to the original style in 2016.

properties.name: Croquet Ground, Knole Road
properties.description: The second of two bombs exploding on the playing ground.

properties.name: Croquet Ground, Knole Road
properties.description: The first of two bombs exploding on the playing ground.

properties.name: Carlton Hotel, Knole Road
properties.description: Gable destroyed, not restored until the late 1950s - early 1960s.

properties.name: Manor House grounds, De La Warr Road
Manor House grounds, De La Warr Road
Maple Walk
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. Damaged a residential dwelling named High Chimneys (now known as Maple House). 2 injured, including 1 hospitalised.

properties.name: Metropole Hotel, West Parade
properties.description: Considerable damage to the front of the building, although unoccupied at the time a postman, Len Crowhurst, was badly injured by falling rubble. Beach Towers Hotel opposite also sustained damage causing loss of one of its turrets.

properties.name: Metropolitan Convalescent Home, Upper Sea Road
Metropolitan Convalescent Home, Upper Sea Road
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb.

properties.name: Millfields Estate
properties.description: 5 injured.

properties.name: Millfields Estate
properties.description: 5 injured.

properties.name: Millfields Estate
properties.description: 5 injured.

properties.name: Motcombe Court, Bedford Avenue
properties.description: A 500kg bomb demolished three upper floors of the east wing. The building was unoccupied apart from the caretaker who suffered superficial injuries. Rebuilt in 1946.

properties.name: New Park Avenue
properties.description: In roadway. Damage to nearby houses.

properties.name: Pebsham Farm
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Farm
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Pebsham Marsh
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb.

properties.name: Post Office rear, Devonshire Square
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Railway siding near Bowles Yard, Reginald Road
Railway, London Road
properties.description: Rear of Corporation Yard.

properties.name: Railway yard, Reginald Road
properties.description: Builders merchants M.P. Harris' crane was 'blown about like a feather' by the bomb blast, landing on the cement store.

properties.name: Rear of allotments, Reginald Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb. Detonated 19 April 1941.

properties.name: Richmond Road
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. The first that landed on the town. Damaged residential property and broke windows at St. Augustine's Church. Left a 30-ft-deep crater. 20 injured, including 10 hospitalised.

properties.name: Rotherfield Avenue
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: Sackville Garage, Bolebrooke Road
properties.description: Completely destroyed.

properties.name: Sackville Hotel, De La Warr Parade
Sackville Hotel, De La Warr Parade
Sackville Hotel, De La Warr Parade
properties.description: 4 small roof fires.

properties.name: Smiths Garage, Victoria Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: St Leonards Road
properties.description: Unexploded bomb.

properties.name: St Mary's Cottages by footpath from Highlands
The Gaiety Cinema, 94 London Road
properties.description: Destroyed and never reopened.

properties.name: The Grange, Upper Sea Road
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. Landed in the garden grounds partially wrecking the house, also caused damage to the Bell Hotel and other adjacent properties. 27 injured, including 7 hospitalised, 1 horse killed.

properties.name: The Mount
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. 1 person injured.

properties.name: The New Club, Channel View West
properties.description: Unexploded bomb possibly dropped 09 October.

properties.name: Town Hall, London Road
properties.description: Damage caused the Borough Accountant and Public Health Department to relocate to Garth Place.

properties.name: Town Hall, London Road
properties.description: Damage caused the Borough Accountant and Public Health Department to relocate to Garth Place.

properties.name: Town Hall Square
properties.description: Damage to shops. Located where the building passage to Sainsbury's is today.

properties.name: Turkey Road
properties.description: Bomb in front garden demolished bungalow and house next door. A terrace opposite (Arncliffe Terrace) was damaged. Families at Arncliffe Terrace and Camperdown Street evacuated.

properties.name: Wealden Way
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. House wrecked, 4 injured.

properties.name: Worsham Manor, Worsham Lane
properties.description: V-1 flying bomb. 2 horses injured.

properties.name: B-17 Flying Fortress
properties.description: In sea south of Clock tower. B-17 ditched due to lack of petrol. Crew of 10 rescued from the sea.

properties.name: Junkers Ju88A-1 Werke Nummer 7036 of 3/KG 51
properties.description: Buckholt Farm. Forced landed due to petrol shortage. Crew of four made POW.

properties.name: Spitfire P9550 Mark I (converted to PR III)
properties.description: 100 yards east of Freezelands Farm building. Serving with 1 Photographic Reconnaissance Unit, it force landed in bad visibility due to lack of petrol whilst returning from a sortie to Rennes, France. Went through a hedge and ended up on its nose, Sergeant Pilot Mills injured.

imgattrib.0: © P R Arnold collection via W Matusiak

properties.name: Spitfire XIV + Tempest V
properties.description: Picknells Green, Hooe. Mid-air collision. On anti-V-1 patrol. Flying Officer Patrick Schade (pictured) and Flight Sergeant Archie Wilson both killed.

properties.name: B-24 Liberator
properties.description: Recreation ground, Bulverhythe. B-24 crashed on return from mission. Crew believed safe, no other details.

properties.name: Avro Lancaster Mark I (ME676 CF-F)
properties.description: Part of 625 squadron. Came down about a quarter of a mile in fields south of the Black & White Garage along Barnhorn Road. It was to have attacked V-weapon facilities at Raimbert, France. It returned with engine failure and its bomb load. The crew baled out and survived.

properties.name: Focke Wulf Fw190 A-5 Werke Nummer 51353 of Stab IV/SKG10
properties.description: Hit by anti-aircraft fire. Attempted a force landing but crashed at Norman's Bay. Pilot Oberleutnant Kurt Hevler killed. Aircraft burnt out. One of 18 FW 190s attacking Eastbourne. Originally buried Bexhill Cemetery plot CD F 23 he was re-interred as part of the consolidation of German war graves at the Soldatenfriedhof, Cannock Chase, in 1967.
